name: Accounting Standards for Not-for-Profit Organizations – What You Need to Know
content: This presentation provides guidance when selecting accounting policies and determining appropriate disclosures, when a not-for-profit matter is not dealt with explicitly in the primary sources of generally accepted accounting principles. Why Should You Attend This session provides guidance for Not-for-Profit Organizations on preparing financial statements by Not-For-Profit Organizations. It specifically focuses on areas that are unique to Not-For-Profit Organizations. Objectives of the Presentation » Concepts underlying the development and use of accounting principles in general purpose financial statements » To understand the concepts underlying the development and use of accounting principles in Not-For-Profit Organizations financial statements Areas Covered in the Session » Accounting treatment for inventories of a not-for-profit organization » Accounting treatment for employee future benefits provided by a not-for-profit organization » Presentation and disclosure standards for financial statements of not-for-profit organizations » Standards for the recognition, measurement, presentation and disclosure of contributions, and related investment income, received by not-for-profit organizations » Standards for the recognition and disclosure of contributions receivable by not-for-profit organizations » Accounting for tangible capital assets held by not-for-profit organizations » Accounting for intangible assets acquired or developed by a not-for-profit organization » Accounting for Contributed assets and write-downs of assets » Disclosure standards for collections held by not-for-profit organizations » Standards for the presentation and disclosure of controlled, significantly influenced and other related entities in the financial statements of not-for-profit organizations » Disclosure standards for related party transactions in the financial statements of not-for-profit organizations » Disclosure standards for a not-for-profit organization that classifies its expenses by function and allocates its expenses to a number of functions to which the expenses relate Who Will Benefit » CEO/CFO » Board members » External auditors » Compliance professionals » Operational professionals » Finance professionals » Internal auditors To Register (or) for more details please click on this below link: https://bit.ly/300IwsV Email: support@abideedict.com Toll Free No:1-844-511-8858 Tel: +1-913-871-1466
